title: Brilliant Care
body:
I attended the practice this week and can honestly say i left feeling much more positive and assured.
The doctor listened to me and i know my appointment was longer that i was allocated but i was not rushed in anyway. I was also seen by the nurse who took my blood pressure and bloods which i do not like and again there was no rush they reassurred me even though i felt i was being a nuisance.
I hope my comments outway the negative as i only receive the best care from the doctors and the staff are always helpful.
Thank you so much for listening and helping me

title: Brilliant Care
body:
I attended the practice this week and can honestly say i left feeling much more positive and assured.
The doctor listened to me and i know my appointment was longer that i was allocated but i was not rushed in anyway. I was also seen by the nurse who took my blood pressure and bloods which i do not like and again there was no rush they reassurred me even though i felt i was being a nuisance.
I hope my comments outway the negative as i only receive the best care from the doctors and the staff are always helpful.
Thank you so much for listening and helping me

title: Great Hospital, Excellent Service and Help
body:
Excellent help, advice, assistance and service from all at The Sandwell City Eye Hospital, Dudley Road, Birmingham.
From entering the main entrance where I was assisted by a very helpful receptionist at the main desk to all the staff in all various departments who treated me. Excellent, excellent service.
Thank you Sandwell City Eye Hospital, Dudley Road, Birmingham and all of your excellent friendly staff.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Lovely staff
body:
Attended for a mammogram 
The staff were lovely so kind so patient so attentive . 
First time that I have been to Preston Road a pleasant experience when dealing with a not so comfortable visit.

title: Great practice
body:
I was worried about may baby.
Doctor lisen very carefully and check the little one.
Very pleased with the consultation.

title: Worst Surgery
body: This is the worst surgery I have ever encountered in my life. 1. No compassion. 2. Extremely unprofessional. 3. Nearly impossible to call them. 4. Don't respond to e-mails & requests. 5. In five years with them I have never been seen by the doctor, it is always nurse, regardless what is the problem.   I about to change it, I would rather drive for half an hour than go there again. Avoid, avoid, avoid!!!

title: So so practice
body:
Still no face to face with a Doctor, no appointments even when you telephone the surgery even though you have received a message from the surgery asking you to make an appointment.
Some receptionists are pleasant and helpful and others rude and talk down to you

title: Shocking service at the walk in clinic Harold Wood
body: On arriving at the Harold Wood Health Centre, my partner asked the desk if X rays were still open after trying to contact them on the phone before arriving, no recognised phone number, was told no as they were "too busy" at 17.30 on the 4/3/22 and advised to go to Queens Hospital despite only having 5 families in the waiting area, on arriving at Queens we was informed that the service was in fact still open until 10pm and staff in fact contacted them directly about turning people away 4. 5 hours before close, drastic change and monitoring required with this walk in service, seems as if they send everyone to Queens and pass on responsibility. take more responsibility and support your colleagues!!

readBy.name: Barking, Havering and Redbridge University Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Would recommend
body:
Very helpful 
Very busy 
Kind and caring lady on reception 
Saw doctor in the surgery. They do a good job of Of dealing with all the new patients from other counties 
Thanks for listening the doctor and the lady on reception

title: Great practice
body: I have been with this practice then just a surgery since I moved here in 1971 and have always had the best from all at the practice

title: This practice does not support full time workers!…
body:
Great difficulty obtaining an appointment. Most recent example - waited 1 week to get a call appointment, which I was advised would be at any point during the afternoon - an approx 6 1/2 hour window.  Unfortunately I had to take a 4 min call during this window that just happened to be when the call was made and no further attempt made after that.
 I start work at 7.30am, incredibly difficult to start calling at 8am and repeatedly re-dial until I get through to speak to someone so by the time work commitments free up to call around lunchtime all appointments have gone for the day ... and so the loop begins again. This booking system just does not support full time workers. Really disappointing service.

title: Kind people
body: I have poor mental health and they have been so kind and patient with me. And I am difficult but they have been helping me. For which I am so so grateful.

title: Saturday appointments
body:
My granddaughter was called for her vaccinations and they gave her an appointment on a Saturday , was really impressed as it was quiet in the waiting room and the nurse was very gentle 
No tears thankfully

title: Unable to get through
body: Unless you are in a position where you don't work its not possible to make an appointment as realistically need to spend the whole day on the phone

title: Bigger is not Better!
body: Having been a patient of this surgery for over 40 years I am sad to say that the service given by the new health centre is terrible in comparison to the care received for so many years by what was a genuine family Doctors. Credit where credit is due their roll out of the Covid Vaccine was excellent and Flu jabs are administered efficiently but that is where it ends. It is hard to assess the medical care because it is practically impossible to get an appointment. Whilst I appreciate the pressures on GP surgeries caused by Covid they seriously need to review their appointment booking system. I am at a loss to understand how any organisation can think it is a good idea to expect patients, many of whom will be ill or suffering to have to phone at 8am for either an urgent on the day consultation or to book a 2 or 7 day advance appointment. It is not possible to book an appointment in a month or two weeks, only 2 or 7 days nor to book an appointment online or even to book an appointment at reception. They seem to have no concept of the fact that some patients simply cannot ring at 8am, due to work or other commitments. Of course the second the phone lines open at 8am so many patients are trying to call, that the phone lines are constantly engaged so it is practically impossible to even get into their queuing system. If you try to call a little later in the morning you might get through but will be told all the appointments have gone, try again tomorrow morning at 8! I saw a GP in December who arranged some blood tests and asked me to book a double appointment with her afterwards to follow up. After about four phone calls and goodness knows how long spent on the phone trying to book this appointment, I was eventually told I couldn’t book a double appointment or a face to face with this doctor. I did manage, some weeks later to get a 10 minute phone consultation only to be told that she didn’t have time to discuss all my issues! Presumably if a Doctor specifically asks you to book an appointment to see them again it is because they think this is necessary so it is extremely frustrating when you cannot do so.  Just this week I had to dial the surgery 121 times at 8am to eventually join the queue at number 24. It took over 30 minutes to get to speak to someone which was actually fairly fast on other occasions it has taken over an hour.

title: Very helpful and reassuring
body: I visited eye clinic today and was seen by a young doctor.  She was so helpful and informative.  She spent a lot of time explaining things to me. I had arrived feeling quite anxious, but left feeling very reassured.  Thank you so much.

readBy.name: East Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Very Rude staff
body: Wife is 40 weeks, went because she was feeling reduced baby movement. After waiting for 2 hours nurse called us. They left her in the room for half an hour. In the meantime I received call from friends house that my 4 year son is extremely sick, constantly vomiting. I requested them to let us. But they were unable to find wife's orange book, when they found it , they shouted at my wife saying why left it here. I told them you left the book there not us, why are you talking like that. I started literally crying to let us go because my 4 yr son suddenly started to vomit. They didn't care they took their own time to write few sentences and then they let us go. What a pathetic service.

readBy.name: Barts Health NHS Trust

title: Wish I lived nearby
body: I assist my elderly aunt who lives nearby. I often use the e consult option and get very quick positive answers. The doctors and staff are very helpful. Sadly my local practice is nowhere near as good! Thank you.

title: Walk in centre
body: Daughter went to urgent centre excellent caring reassuring treatment. Quick and efficient.Thank you to all staff.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Negligent doctors and receptionist
body: I am absolutely disgusted with the treatment I have just received from Highlands surgery. I called at 8am this morning feeling extremely unwell and to book a doctors appointment as I thought I may have tonsillitis. I was told a doctor would call me back. It then got to 5pm I had not received a call. I called back to speak with a doctor and was told by the receptionist that they were too busy to let me know but the doctors advisor said ‘it sounds like a viral infection’. I have been sitting in pain for 9 hours and the receptionists excuse was ‘sorry I’m not an octopus’. They did not let me speak to a doctor to confirm whether I have a viral infection or something worse so I am no better off than when I called this morning. The bare minimum treatment would be to let me know any feedback given, and I didn’t even receive that.

title: Thorough
body: I went for a routine test and the nurse noticed that I'd not had blood tests recently and I got an appointment to have a full blood screen.The staff were also very pleasant.

title: Good practice
body: The clinic is good and they provide good service to there customers. They have helped me alot and they give good customer service to there clients

title: Terrible practice
body: Absolutely diabolical and impossible to get through on the phones from 8.15am. I telephoned this morning, was caller number 7 and when the lady answered by 8.21, the call was disconnected! They don't bother calling you back if that happens so I redialled and started at the back of the queue again, caller number 24! Total farce! I tried calling yesterday and I was on hold for over 60 minutes only to be fobbed off! Can't they set up a better system to deal with the volume of calls every morning? stop taking on new patients if you can't cope! If I could move somewhere else I would and change gps immediately! Would not recommend. Avoid for the sake of retaining your mental health. If getting an appointment is stressful, the rest of your health issues will pale into insignificance. The day you get through in time, feels like you've won the lottery. What has the world come to?

title: Great listener
body: I went to visit the gp after a course of antibiotics for a suspected cellulitis in my leg. After the visit the doctor got me an appointment that afternoon at the hospital for an ultrasound and 2 bloodclots were found. Thanks to her taking a little time and listening she has saved me a possible dangerous situation arising and I'm getting the treatment I need.

title: Made my day
body:
I owe the nurse who saw me ‘out of turn’ and patiently removed a ‘lost’ piece of a hearing aid, after I expected an assessment and a referral to far away ENT or Audiology at some future date.

This is what Parkside Family Practice does. 😊

title: Great doctors let down by front of house
body: The practice has efficient, caring and compassionate doctors who are particularly strong with responding to young children. Unfortunately the reception staff let down the practice. There is one receptionist who is kind and practical and seems to actually want to answer the phone. Others are abrupt and rude and answer phone calls as though you are an inconvenience. I’m able to tolerate this and navigate the system for myself and my child but I am writing this review because for others this may not be the case. The reality is that the receptionist staff are front of house and represent the practice as well providing access to the care patients need. If this is mostly poor it let’s down the rest of the team. I worry for more vulnerable patients who may give up at the first hurdle if they encounter one of the rude receptionists and what implications this may have. It just seems something relatively easy to solve, some decent training and higher expectations of reception staff.

title: Super helpful reception staff
body: Everyone moans about GP receptionists, but in this practice they are super helpful. They try their hardest to find appointments and help in every way they can.

title: Excellent practice
body: Doctors, Nurse Practicioners and Receptionists are extremely caring, helpful and professional. Thank you for a much appreciated service given by all at The Castle Practice

title: Above and beyond
body: Generally, but especially over the last two years this practice has gone above and beyond to provide a superb, efficient service to the people of Bridgnorth. Mass vaccinations were carried out and telephone consultations with face to face appointments if necessary took place. Staff is still wearing scrubs and masks but it’s evident from their eyes just how tired and exhausted they are.

title: Good
body: In general the practice is good . Good  patient care. Need to be able to book routine appointments to see gp now

title: Not what it was
body: I joined spitle surgery when it was first set up some 30-35  years ago. And I’ve been a patient ever since, I’ve moved house three times in that period of time and each time I have asked the doctors if they want me to move and I have been told no no we know your medical history and we will take care of you. Recently I had a letter asking me to leave because I was outside their territory by quarter of a mile, I rang the surgery and asked a Doctor Who wrote the letter to ring me I never got a call, I had an occasion to go for a breath  test with another doctor and was taken to the car park at the rear of the surgery to perform this test. And recently I phoned to ask for some information about the medication, I was told by the receptionist that she was not qualified to give me that information so I asked for a Dr Call to be told no he won’t call you contact your pharmacy, this I did I was told by the pharmacy to contact my GP I still have never received a call regarding that request. Without any shadow of doubt the surgery has certainly gone downhill over the years, and I would not recommend them to anybody who is thinking of joining.

title: Great Care & Practice Given By Nurse
body: My grandma attended the urgent care centre after feeling unwell. She contacted the centre at 5pm and was given an appointment for 6.30pm the same evening. She was seen by a lovely nurse who my grandma said was kind and caring. She put my grandma at ease and when the centre closed, she even gave her a lift closer to home when she knew she was alone and had to get a taxi. This nurse is an asset to the urgent care centre as well as the NHS! Thank you for the care and attention you gave to my grandma - she was so grateful!

title: Like not having a doctor, unresponsive
body: Multiple phone calls, emails and online forms and no success. I have requested medication via the online tool on the 23rd of February.  Nothing at all happened.  I phoned to follow up and was told it will be processed but again nothing happened. I phoned again and was told a doctor would phone me, but nobody called.  I am experiencing no duty of care and it is like not having a doctor at all.

title: Excellent
body: Had no problems with the surgery visit. Waiting room was very clean. The receptionist was very helpful with an enquiry. Didn’t have to wait my appointment was on time. The nurse I saw was lovely and patient with me.

title: IS ANYBODY THERE?
body: I repeatedly called the office at Forest Court to enquire about my husband, and no one picked up.  Should there not be someone manning the phone for a relative to check on their loved one?

title: Complex patient wasn't listened to
body: Shame some doctors are concerned for your health others read your notes then ignore them. Really poor service. Would love to give direct feedback and explain the impact of living with pain. Thehospital turn around urgent nerve conduction tests within a week, the doctors even when asked can't be bothered to read them to the patient three weeks later. All the time your living with pain.

title: Terrible
body: Never give you sufficient help. I’ve been with this practice for EIGHTEEN YEARS. At the start they were good but in more recent years their standards have really gone out the window. The receptionists aren’t very helpful and quite rude some of them are. In addition, when you receive test results they don’t contact you. I waited weeks until I decided to call them and they told me about my results. If you want a practice who actually cares and will give you sufficient help, don’t use this one.

title: Lost correspondence. Bad Doctoring. Unworkable…
body: I visited the drs last year with a very clear set of circumstances and requests based on family medical history. I now know the tests I asked for were not carried out and my notes were listed as something other than what I attended the clinic about. Furthermore I visited last week and they rushes tests through as they were missed last time. I haven't been able to get an appointment with the Dr so paid to see a private Dr. They referred me to a specialist at some heinous cost, and I requested simple data from my GP and VMC and nothing happened. I dropped in a letter of notes yesterday from my specialist that needed to be actioned urgently and upon visiting today to check why I hadn't heard anything, it turns out they have lost my letter. I fortunately hade a duplicate. This is all to say the system there is broken, they phone lines are a disaster. No priority to pick up, I waited on hold for 49 mins yesterday before being cut off when they picked it up. So I ended up wailing in. No support, no open arms value of ones health and functioning by a very broken playbook. I will be leaving this practice and would suggest you think carefully before becoming a patient. BTW, you can never every get an appointment unless its down as an emergency. Not being able to see a Dr other than a phone call is responsible for me being hospitalised just over e hear ago with something that was actually a very minor issue- that would have been cleared up by seeing a dr in person and a prescription. Note. The receptionists are doing the best that they can do and have to deal with a lot of pressure from the public, because the system is not working. I do feel for them, however, the service lives and dies with communication, personal visits and assigned Dr/Patient knowledge.  As soon as the issue I'm going through is completed, I will leave this practice.  [A very disappointed 48 year old male]

title: Great Clinic
body:
Could not fault the excellent service I received from this clinic.  Brilliant customer service the whole time.
Kept me informed every step of the way.
Would highly recommend them.

title: Better than many
body: Having read the negative reviews I would like to make a positive. All surgeries are under pressure and many friends in other areas have real cause for concern. My experience of Beacon is that it is holding up well under the pressure. Making an appointment can be very frustrating at any practice but Beacon is easier than many although not up to pre Covid status yet. Should we just vent in a review...of course not! I am still happy to say I am well treated here and if you really want to go somewhere you expect to have personal treatment then go private. Beacon is more than adequate for all others.

title: Effective Therapy
body:
The therapy sessions I have received have given me tools to support me long term. Each session was tailored to my specific needs. Discussions were non judgemental and gave me the space to analyse and change my thinking patterns. 
My sessions were remote due to CoVid restrictions, however this supported me better in accessing the therapy. In future, I would choose this option again, if available.

readBy.name: Midlands Partnership NHS Foundation Trust o

title: Well looked after.
body:
Following a faint went to Newton Abbot A&E. Dealt with there quickly and effectively with ECG. Confident and considerate A&E practitioner. Referred straight away  to Torbay MRU for further tests. Dealt with straight away. Nurse was confident, efficient and friendly. After blood tests and ECG given consultation by doctor (plus trainee) and then sent for lung x-ray. Collected by porter and wheelchair (tough I could have walked!); also friendly and efficient. X-rayed within minutes and returned to MRU. Short wait until debriefed on full outcome (all clear) by trainee doctor. 
While in MRU offered biscuits, evening snack meal (not needed), and beverages.
All in all a positive experience, dealt with as a person all the time, not just as an anonymous patient.

readBy.name: Torbay and South Devon NHS Foundation Trust
Plymouth University, BSc Nursing (Adult) 2021

title: Health Harmonie - Hednesford
body:
We visited the Anglesey Stree clinic.
The building was not what I'd expect for an NHS service. Grimey and not well looked after.

The receptionist was rather short and un
welcoming.

The nurse returned from her cigarette break, bringing a plume of smoke and cigarette odour with her and simply called my daughters name without stopping expecting us to follow.

The doctor was not friendly, rather cold and rude. My daughter has autism and was sat cuddling her teddy (she's teen age), he seemed to have no consideration for how she was feeling. When I spoke, as her parent, he was dismissive of me and talked at me.

Very unprofessional service and one that will have contributed further to my daughters dislike of medical appointments.

title: Excellent Medical Centre
body:
I feel very lucky and privileged to be a patient at Claughton Medical Centre.  The reception staff are friendly, kind and always helpful.
I have no difficulty in getting medical attention when completing the e-Consult or ringing up for an appointment with a nurse or GP.  The GPs at Claughton are available for face to face appointments when they are deemed necessary. All the GPs are sympathetic and easy to talk to.
The practice is run very efficiently. This is always obvious when mass vaccinations take place. Congratulations to the Practice Manager!
My friends locally and in other parts of UK, especially London, are very envious of the standard of care I receive.

title: Excellent practice
body: Such wonderful service, extremely kind, professional, efficient and great communication. Excellent service from all members of staff.

title: Excellent practice
body: Such wonderful service, extremely kind, professional, efficient and great communication. Excellent service from all members of staff.

title: Great service.
body: I have had excellent service from Spamedica and would willingly recommend them to others. The people I came into contact with were all very kind and professional.

title: Great team work
body:
Hello,

Friday night me and my daughter Jessica Barretto attended A&E in St Helier hospital.
I was very tired after 12 hours shift and when come back home found out that my daughter fells very poorly.
 Two hours waiting was challenging but it was worth it. Young doctor Niall was very professional, he talked with my daughter through and explain her about what happens with her and what she has to do in the future to prevent this happens to her again. 
All staff was very friendly, nurse took great care about my daughter. 
I was so tired couldn’t even talk, that’s why it was nice to see my daughter involvement in conversation and remembered everything what she has to do.

Great work team 👏👏

Thank you very much 

Galina&Neil and Jessica Barretto

title: Friendly Proffesional
body:
I have now had both my eye cataracts operated on.
During my four visits to Sayers Common (Brighton) the staff have always been friendly, polite and professional during what was a painless experience.

They explained all the procedures in an easy understandable way.

My sight has been vastly improved.
Thank you so much to all the staff.

title: Above and beyond
body: I am writing with regard to two GPs who have gone above and beyond what you would normally expect. Personally, one doctor (I wish I could name her) has helped me so much, has phoned me on numerous occasions to check on how I am doing and has always followed through with the appropriate action. Also, my mum recently had amazing care from another one of our doctors (again, I wish I could name her) which went beyond what we expected. Both doctors are a real asset to this surgery. Thank you so very much for the genuine and kind care we have received.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Not recommend
body: I am suffering with pain in shoulder for a year and I can't have a decent treatment. I spend over one hour to have a opportunity to talk with the receptionist and when I get it they say it is no appointment available. Since I moved to this gp I never ever see a doctor from there, only by phone call and now I can't even have phone call with the doctor to discuss my situation because as I said they are telling me there is no appointment available.

title: Unable to make contact
body: I phoned all day and was always 20 something in the queue. I can't wait in queues all day at one stage I was in the same position for 30 minutes.I tried the engage consult as advised in recorded message. This doesn't work either. There doesn't seem to be an email contact anymore either so I have no idea what I'm meant to do.

title: Great service
body: Very well looked after from start to finish information given was very easy to understand and informative

title: Very slow
body: Called for Ambulance at 05.30am after father having a stroke, took More than 2 hrs to turn up (what happen to think Fast!) Had to ring 3x to follow up there where abouts!! This service surely needs to be looked into. Cant believe there were no services. Very upsetting.

readBy.name: East Midlands Ambulance Service

title: Great staff that went the extra mile
body: I had to attend A&E late on a Friday night, which isn't the best time to go I expect, but right from the start the staff were fantastic. From the door security, reception, nurses, and doctors, the service was excellent and a number of times they went above and beyond of what would reasonably be expected.  I was there for 10 hours, and my stay was made as comfortable and supported as possible.

readBy.name: Gastroenterology Department, Queen's Medical Centre

title: Very Poor
body: Impenetrable. Reception prevents access to healthcare pros or otherwise; being barred from face to face contact leaves one talking through an intercom at the foyer which is alienating, unwelcoming and embarrassing (regarding personal details being required); impossible to get through on the phone and when you do there are never any available appointments. Behind the polite apologies of receptionists there is no service being offered; it is like ringing a 'call centre' where the responses come from a fixed set of questions where the individuals are not taken seriously. Very disappointed. Furthermore, the NHS needs to move on from Covid-19 being the excuse.

title: Great hospital
body: The only negative thing I can say is regarding A&E and I don't think it is anything you can fix. No complaints about staff and treatment care at all, the problem as I see it is your A&E would need to be double the size it is now to be able to cope more efficiently, it's overwhelming seeing all the trollies in the corridors and most disconcerting for your patients. I think the NHS should consider reopening the units they closed in other local hospitals like Burnley. As things are it will only get worst.

readBy.name: East Lancashire Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Kind, welcoming & caring :)
body: I visited the urgent treatment centre in Redcar today with my little girl who had fallen and hurt her wrist. Every member of staff that dealt with us that day from the health care assistant, to the radiographer, to the nurse who treated her and diagnosed her with a buckle fracture the care and compassion they gave I must say was outstanding. My little girl is three years of age and she was very frightened that her hand “was broken” they spoke to her in a way she could understand and I just feel the staff need commending for the way they approached a very scared little girl (and an even more scared mother). A credit to our NHS 💗

readBy.name: South Tees Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: A&E visit
body:
I have sadly had been advised to attend A&E on 3 occasions in the last few months. 
The staff on every visit have been kind, caring and understanding. 
The NHS has been under tremendous pressure but my experience was 1st class.

readBy.name: Western Sussex Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
Healthwatch Sussex

title: Extraordinary
body:
Some serious help needs to be given to Southmead A&E in the form of organisation & prioritising. To say it is shambolic would be an understatement. The current system is not fit for purpose and it was my observation that there were several areas of failure. The has nothing to do with covid or short staff. You could run A& E as a military field hospital and prioritise better so the traffic flow is much improved. I also observed stafff talking loudly about holidays , coronation street & other insignificances. I also observed very agitated patients some who had been there 12 hours.
I was with a friends daughter who was in great distress and was forced to wait 9 hours before being triaged .

readBy.name: North Bristol NHS Trust

title: Appointments
body: I have been a patient of the surgery ever since it opened,and the staff are friendly and professional,BUT getting an appointment is unbelievable!!! I am 80years old have cancer.Needing an appointment I was advised that the best way to get one was to be at the surgery at 8 am!!because getting through on the phone is well nigh impossible!!! I despair! I really do!!!

title: Long wait in surgery
body: I made an appointment  to actually  see a GP as requested  by the GP. I had to wait 45 minutes before I was seen. There wasn't  a patient  with the GP but when I enquired why the long  wait I was told the doctor  was making  calls to patients.  .why make an appointment  only to keep me sitting in the surgery for 45 minutes, when I actually  saw the doctor I had a satisfactory  consultation but talking to other patients  this is a usual problem. Why ? Surely the patients waiting should be seen on time if possible and telephone  calls made later.

title: Wonderful support
body:
I visited the department on 2/3/22
I can only describe myself as completely terrified as I had experienced trauma in the past. I contacted the department prior to my appointment and explained my difficulty. On the day I was greeted by a wonderful nurse who told me she was going to look after me. I felt better already. The consultant took time to ask about my problem and my fear. There was no rush, we took it a step at a time. The consultant asked if I was ok to proceed with each step. I felt understood and supported the whole time and got through what felt like an impossible thing. 
I can't thank them enough for what they did for me.

readBy.name: Royal United Hospital Bath NHS Trust

title: So grateful to the amazing staff
body: I was unfortunate to need some help and had to visit A&E in a hurry. I was seen within a couple of minutes and in specialist care within 5 minutes. The staff from the most senior to those training are all so caring polite and great people. The ward staff work non stop and nothing is too much trouble. Thank you.

readBy.name: Dorset County Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Good practice
body: I was well looked after and the practitioner was attentive and listened to my problems. I received an injection which has helped slightly and my practitioner is contacting me at the end of the month to see how I’m progressing

title: Amazing!
body:
We visited on Xmas eve 2021. We waited around an hour and the nurses kept an eye on how long we were waiting due to my sons young age. They explained that they were waiting for someone with paediatric experience to see my son. 
My son was 5 weeks old at the time and had been projectile vomiting for 10days. He had been sent home the week before from A and E and had also been assessed by our own GP too. I was encouraged by my health visitor to seek more medical advice. 
My son was seen by a Doctor who suspected that he had a rare tummy condition (which he did). I explained my son had been told that he had reflux and a viral infection (misdiagnosed) and he wrote us a letter and sent us onto kettering A and E where he was admitted and he had surgery on 28.12.21. Without that doctor that day his outcomes could have been so much worse. Thank you Doctor you are an incredible,  we are forever grateful.

title: Didn't even call Back
body: Logged an appointment using Klinik for my elderly father and nobody even called back. The repeat prescription service is a joke as you cannot order half of the meds online and they seem to have too many patients to get an appointment. Patient care out of the window these days.

title: Waiting time
body: I visited this hospital recently and didn’t get past the waiting area I had to leave after 2 and half hours of waiting to go into have endoscopy I left feeling even more I’ll through having zero food or drink since the day before I really don’t want to go back there would prefer to use a normal NHS hospital only my gp sent me there I was made to feel awkward being an NHS not a private patient

title: Not interested
body: Tried 4 days to get an appointment,  at last got a telephone consultation.,then got a text,  doctor couldn't even speak to me. I've been with this practice for 64 years and my dog has better health care than me, he can see a vet within 24 hours. When you speak to the receptionist, all you get is try tomorrow (if you can get through) very very poor!

title: very proffesional
body: was very afraid but nurses doctors were reassuring very proffesional  kind throughout   great  team nurses but me at ease were understanding  thedoctors also were understanding  very  polite proffesional friendly   great well done  thankyou

title: Fantastic Service
body:
I recently had cause to take my wife to Barnet Hospital to attend the TIA / Stroke Clinic. This was short notice, as indeed I am sure many of these appointments are, and we were invited to attend at 11am. Clearly this is a tense time for anybody and we were no exceptions. We were kept waiting for a while which was no problem and then seen by the Nurse in charge of the TIA clinic who most efficiently sent us off for a neck ultrasound scan, followed by a MRI brain scan. We were then seen by a consultant who was able to reassure us after seeing the results of the tests that there had not been a TIA or stroke and we could relax on that score. He said to be completely certain he would like an ECG and blood tests done, which the Nurse once again sorted with efficiency and aplomb. We are happy not to have heard anything further as this is a case of no news is good news.

The way we were treated and spoken to and made to feel welcome and relaxed was exceptional. Absolutely the best advertisement for the NHS you could have and a massive thank you from both of us.

In the difficult times we now live in we were so impressed.

readBy.name: Royal Free London NHS Foundation Trust

title: Absolutely appalling communication
body:
My father is currently (unfortunately) an inpatient at the Royal London. He was taken in 5 days ago for a routine operation and was told he would be out in a few days. We are now 5 days in, at least 15 telephone calls and yet not one person has called a single member of his family to advise them what is happening.

My sister, mother and I have called numerous times, when it's not engaged it just rings and rings. Between us we have managed to speak to a nurse on five occasions. Each time we have been told that a doctor will call us back with an update as to what is happening to my father, each time nothing has happened.

We can't visit despite the website saying we can because this ward "has different rules". The whole thing is quite frankly disgusting, I hope and pray that I am never taken to this hospital.

readBy.name: Barts Health NHS Trust

title: Amazing Staff
body: My journey with the Richmond clinic began when I found out I was unexpectedly pregnant at 18 weeks. I attended the Richmond Clinic for the first time at 22 weeks gestation. I had to undergo a surgical abortion under general anaesthetic - with the procedure being separated into two parts. I began the procedure with the dilapan insertion the day before the surgery - it was probably the most difficult part for me physically, I would be an extremely anxious person and the nurses were more than understating, compassionate and extremely reassuring. The following day I came back in around 8.30am and went up to theatre around 10.30am, I was okay with the wait as you are expected to be there all day. Again, the nurses before theatre check in on you and were extremely supportive. When I went up to theatre I was nervous as it was my first time receiving GA, I was greeted and introduced to the anaesthetist team and they were very reassuring. Next thing I know I am waking up in the ward with a nurse monitoring me as soon as I woke, given a glass of water and rested there until ready to move to recovery room where I was given tea and biscuits. I was fortunate enough to wake up without any nausea or extreme drowsiness, which I was worried about beforehand. I was allowed to leave around 40 minutes to and hour after being in the recovery room. The nurses were lovely enough to let my partner come up to the discharge room and stay in the wait room while I was in surgery and also updated him on how I was doing when I came to recovery room. The staff were wonderful - they deal with such a difficult daunting time with such care and compassion. I felt completely reassured the whole time I was there. Don’t be afraid to ask as many questions as you feel like they are so accommodating and understanding. Thank you so much to all the staff members there for looking after me and making me feel so reassured. Robyn

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

title: Excellent care
body: After waiting months for my results from the hospital, I rang the practice and the receptionist told me she would chase them, and within 15 minutes she rang me back with the results, and the next day I had an appointment. Amazing service from this receptionist, great practice all round. Thanks again

title: Restrictions
body: It is such a shame that when going for an initial consultation about a cancer diagnosis a wife is not allowed to attend with her husband. This is very distressing

readBy.name: Spire Healthcare

title: Always been a good experience
body: I know like every surgery, they have struggled in the pandemic. I was seen face to face in the pandemic, they didn't lock their doors. The doctors have always been lovely , responsive but hard to get to. Which is my only complaint.

title: Faultless Caring
body:
From booking -in to the final diagnosis by the doctor it was first class.
I was referred to RLI Lancaster for urgent treatment which was also first class. The staff were very professional. Thank you all!

title: WORST Medical Practice EVER
body:
Unhelpful rude receptionist. Inadequate GP s with no real concern for patient care. Failed to issue prescription repeatedly for 3 months , making me more unwell. 
Totally unfit for for purpose .

title: Terrible service
body: My experience with ICMC the last 4.5 years has been extremely dreadful. Most recently I've been struggling with depression and it's impossible to get proper care. There is no regular doctor that assesses my mood and reaction to the medication. I feel like their lab rat as they sound very amateur in treating mental health (among other conditions I sought help for in the past). Last time a doctor called me to review my medication completely out of the blue and was asking me if I believe I should go into a new medication, without explaining anything to me about it, and expecting me to be at a position of making an informed decision. Apart from the badly trained doctors, even worse is the reception staff. I have countless time felt belittled by the staff on the phone. My most recent experience two days ago, I called to ask why I haven't been contacted after I completed my eConsult 2 days ago and the receptionist on the phone was abrasive and sarcastic when I told her I don't remember when I completed it. Depression can cause memory problems and the staff need to get some compassion training. Really awful service

title: 23 Hour Wait in A&E
body: 20 year old daughter was sent to A&E by GP.  Severe colitis and bleeding.  Rude triage nurse suggesting it wasn’t an emergency followed by a 23 hour wait sitting in a chair in the department before eventually transferring to a bed in gastro ward the following day.  Stayed in for 5 days so was very unwell.  The care on the ward was excellent.  Totally unacceptable wait in A&E.  Daughter was exhausted and had to beg for somewhere to lie down.  She was told elderly and vulnerable patients would be given priority despite being very unwell herself.

title: Childrens a & e
body:
Was told to go to my nearest a and e on Thursday by the ambulance services to get my 2 year old checked out due to possible epilepsy.  
All staff we came across were professional, helpful and put me at ease and they were good with my little boy who is non verbal and autistic.
Only negative thing I will say, my husband was asked to leave as it was only 1 parent however I saw about 3 children there with both sets of parents. I appreciate things under the current issues of the last 2 years but a bit of consistency Leicester.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Leicester NHS Trust

title: Irresponsible staff
body: With a view to change from another practice to Thorndike Surgery, I submitted two applcations in January 2022. After 20 days I was told, they were lost. Again I submitted in mid February 2022. When I enquired the receptionist, she was not giving a firm answer, but later confirmed I was registered. Five days back I rang at 08.05 for booking an appointment, waited for 25 minutes as I was  11th on the queue. The automated message system was going on, and when my turn arrived, the receptionist in a funny voice told there were only two slots which were given to the first two in the queue. I got annoyed for wasting my time in the name of ease of administration. The machine should have programmed to tell all over. I feel the NHS primary care needs a root and branch change, whereby the patient should be in control.

title: Excellent Food
body: My elderly mother has been an in-patient for a month so far (admitted 05/02/2022). She has nothing but praise for the staff in general but has been particularly keen to praise the standard of the catering. She has said that the food is of an excellent standard in terms of both quality and quantity. The menu is varied and provide a wide range of options. I would like to pass on sincere thanks on behalf of my mother to all QA staff but in particular to the catering team working behind the scenes.

title: Some thoughts
body:
Visited Children and Young People A&E. It was unusually busy, I think most of the time the waiting area is probably much more comfortable than when it is as crowded as it was on this occasion. The staff were very nice although obviously overwhelmed. 

There aren't any baby changing facilities!! Madness for an area specifically for treating children. We were there for 5 hours with a 1 year old baby so you've got to expect at least 2 or 3 nappy changes being necessary.

title: What a great service!
body: Really good and efficient service that I have never experienced before when seeing medical professionals. The knowledge of staff and the equipment used to determine my issue was fantastic. The system was so well managed, I saw physios, had an ultrasound, and was given exercises.

title: Lovely Nurses.
body: I had to ring for a district nurse last night as my catheter was leaking. they came very quickly and sorted me out. Very nice I thank them all very much.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield
Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: HOLEP Surgery
body: I received excellent treatment during my time at Russell’s Hall hospital for HOLEP surgery. The surgery has been a success. The staff in C6 were professional, caring and kind , even the food was good !

readBy.name: The Dudley Group NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great carers, hopeless management.
body:
I always had carers I liked, they were almost universally nice. Unfortunately, every single dealing I had with the admin side was a disastrous shambles. Not bothering to tell me about staff sickness. Not bothering to tell me if they had to come on a different day. Being totally incompetent when it came to receiving payment for my bill. Eventually I said that was it, I was leaving. 
And then having the cheek to say they'd undercharged me & could I pay them an outstanding £100? I only needed very light care, but I couldn't stop thinking about how you'd cope with this level of incompetence if you had more complex care needs.

title: Accommodating & exceptional care
body:
After having a operation I needed staples removing from several keyhole wound sites. My local GP surgery were unable to fit me in so told me to see if the Whitworth could help.  I made an appointment with them, but the day before this was due the wounds felt quite painful, so I called in the Whitworth & asked for advice.  They were so helpful & managed to see me straight away to remove the staples.  The nurse who removed them was very gentle & provided excellent care & advised me how to look after the wounds when I got home. 
This hospital provides valuable care to this community & I feel very lucky to have access to the services it offers. Thank you all for your hard work & exceptional care.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Always happy with Wrafton!
body:
I have been struggling with my asthma recently and have been looked after wonderfully by everyone. I am grateful for the great care and communication. 

Thank you!

title: Highly satisfied
body: Attended for hip injection in theatre. Staff very helpful and friendly. Everything explained. Very clean and tidy.

readBy.name: Healthwatch Sheffield

title: Stressed
body: I'm trying to make an appointment as soon as possible I've been ringing each morning at 8 as your told to do and you end up 30 plus in queue how the he'll dose that work ahhhhhhh

title: Private
body:
Today no Dr available to see my 6 year old with severe ear ache 
Nurse wrote the name of a pharmacist in upminster and said go there which we did and was given a 27 quid bill 
It was private and we were not told

readBy.name: Mid Essex Hospital Services NHS Trust

title: Superb Service
body: Visited on Sunday afternoon (6th March).   Seen promptly by helpful and thorough staff members.  Triage, and 2 nurses including a dressing change in under 1 1/2 hours. Detailed advice given at the conclusion.    Very happy patient.

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Practice
body: Not having visited the drs for many years I attended back in December with a sore shoulder but whilst there mentioned a couple of what I thought were minor health issues. The doctor listened carefully and arranged for all the appropriate blood tests and I then went back for a follow up appointment. Within a week of attending the first appointment I was diagnosed as having diabetes & hypertension and had a doctors appointment to feedback the results and implement a treatment plan and then I had a follow up with the nurse. The advice & education was excellent. I was even lent a BP monitor for the first month. Recently I have attended the surgery for an injection in my shoulder and the service again was superb. Hygiene standards were faultless and in less than a week my problem has been 90% resolved. I work as a Senior Nurse with one of the specialists ODNs and I can honestly say the standard of care provided at this practice is excellent. The doctor was very understanding and listened, the receptionists were excellent in arranging appointments and contacting me and both the nurse who took my bloods and the other one who did my diabetic appointment were faultless and very professional. Having not visited the surgery for a long time I was impressed by the standard of the waiting area with a lovely new floor and clean environment and they had an excellent system for managing Covid restrictions. The whole team were professional and caring and a credit to the NHS. Thank you.

readBy.name: Ulster University, MBBS (Medicine) 2021

title: Brilliant hospital
body: I have had both eyes done and am very pleased with way I was treated especially as I was still recovering from a broken hip I was helped everywhere especially to get on the table

title: So efficient
body: Only moved to Winchester within the past 18 months. Every interaction with St Paul's has been slick and efficient - receptionists, GPs, physio. Lovely pleasant people to deal with. So much better than my experience in SE London.

title: Excellent service at this GP practice
body:
I had my mole removal and follow up recently at Victoria Medical Centre under the capable and professional hands of a GP and can not highly recommend and praise him enough! A first class, thorough and authoritative doctor who is highly experienced in the field of mole removal and whom can be trusted completely.  He expertly and painlessly removed my mole with such precision.   A true professional with a breadth of in-depth knowledge and sound advise.  His expertise is evident in his professional and diagnostic acumen and first class efficiency.  He is known for his patient centred care.  Approachable and humble in his manner as well as kind, caring and compassionate and often goes beyond his call of duty to answer questions and help. 

This GP was recommended to me by many people (even Harley Street specialist) – I now recommend him to anyone in need of a mole removal.  A first class, extremely and highly experienced, mole removal specialist whom I would not hesitate recommending strongly enough within this GP surgery.

title: District nursing neighbourhood team
body: The quality of expertise, care and compassion that my mom and we received as a family from the district nurses was excellent in our time of need I cant thank this amazing team of nurses enough. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. They supported us and cared for mom in her last days so that she could stay at home with me where she wanted to be.

title: Great dietician
body: Really helpful and knowledgeable, tailored advice to suit what was best for you. Non judgmental and felt that she genuinely wanted to help
